posts.name: Natalia
posts.cooked:
Our team has just started to do an autonomous, we have Mk4i swerve modules with neos, we find that every time we run a straight line path, our robot overshoots. One of our teammates  found some strange proportions like if we advance 1 meter in real life our robot would consider it as 3 meters. In other words we never got to fully implement the path planner. We are very lost in how to fix these issues and would appreciate any help regarding path planner.

main

posts.name: Nelson Green (1108 Mentor Coach Electrical Programming)
posts.cooked: I wonder if you are using wheel diameter somewhere that you need wheel circumference.  And you are overshooting by π (3.14).
posts.display_username: Nelson Green (1108 Mentor Coach Electrical Programming)

posts.cooked: did that customized pid value come from testing?

posts.name: Natalia
posts.cooked: Yes, we didn’t know what value to use so we just put a random value and then tested it. When running our autonomous it didn’t matter what value it had, since our robot would pretty much still overshoot

reply_to_user.name: Nelson Green (1108 Mentor Coach Electrical Programming)

posts.name: Rod
posts.cooked:
You certainly have the classic symptoms of the wrong ratio of motor rotations to wheel travel.

I would do a quick visual check with the power off.  Rotate the wheel one turn and count turns on the motor shaft.  This will confirm your drive ratio.

I’d check the diameter of the wheel with calipers.  On treaded wheels measure at the root of the tread, not the peak.

The next check is to look for unit conversion errors.  Pi is a popular one, and “2”, coming from Radius vs Diameter.  And, of course, variations on 25.4 for inches to millimeters.

For an error this big, its likely something like a programming error or the drive gearing not being what you thought.  Wheel diameter errors are usually much smaller: 10% or so.

posts.name: Natalia
posts.cooked: Update: We measured the rations of motor rotations to wheel travel and we also made sure our encoders were measuring the distances correctly. And everything works just fine when we don’t use path planner. We made an autonomous PID without path planner and everything turned out perfect. We don’t really understand what else could be going on.
can i see yalls pathplanner setting

posts.name: Mete Karadeniz
posts.cooked: As far as i understand your drive motor ratio giving the error. Since you are using MK4i the drive gear ratio needs to be 6.12 if it has a L3 gear in the swerve module. Also your trackwidth constants are not matching with pathplanners settings.
